definition: double income family who have pets rather than children (see also 丁克[ding1 ke4])
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
"a slave to certificates", sb who does one's utmost to obtain as many certificates as possible so to be more employable
(bird species of China) pied avocet (Recurvirostra avosetta)
impossible to separate/impossible to disentangle/cannot take time out
